qas.question: Which civil war did the Iraq branch of Al Qaeda begin fighting in?
With support from Syrians, what did the Iraq branch of Al Qaeda rename themselves to?

answers.text: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIS/ISIL)

qas.question: What part of Iraq did ISIS invade?
What relationship do Al Qaeda and ISIS now have?

plausible_answers.text: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIS/ISIL)

qas.question: What group split the Iraq insurgency and Syrian Civil War?
Which two groups do analysts believe have combined?
What country did Syria covertly invade?

context: In a major split in the ranks of Al Qaeda's organization, the Iraqi franchise, known as Al Qaeda in <b9_0>Iraq<b9_0/> covertly invaded Syria and the Levant and began participating in the ongoing <a0_0>Syrian<a0_0/> Civil War, gaining enough support and strength to re-invade Iraq's <a2_0>western<a2_0/> provinces under the name of the <a1_0><b5_0>Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIS/ISIL)<b5_0/><a1_0/>, taking over much of the country in a blitzkrieg-like action and combining the Iraq insurgency and Syrian Civil War into a single conflict. Due to their extreme brutality and a complete change in their overall ideology, <a3_0>Al Qaeda's core organization<a3_0/> in <b8_0>Central Asia<b8_0/> eventually denounced <b6_0>ISIS<b6_0/> and directed their affiliates to cut off all ties with this organization. Many analysts[who?] believe that because of this schism, <b7_0>Al Qaeda and ISIL<b7_0/> are now in a <a4_0>competition<a4_0/> to retain the title of the world's most powerful terrorist organization.
